meanings.definition: The state or quality of not being able to be enforced.
meanings.sent1: The nonenforceability of the rule led to chaos in the classroom.
meanings.sent2: The nonenforceability of the contract made it difficult to ensure compliance.
meanings.sent3: The nonenforceability of the 'no running' rule resulted in a race around the school.
meanings.sent4: The nonenforceability of the law turned the city into a free-for-all.
meanings.sent5: The nonenforceability of the policy allowed for creative interpretations.

meanings.sent1: The nonenforceability of the agreement caused disputes among the parties.
meanings.sent2: Without enforceability, the contract was essentially meaningless.
meanings.sent3: The nonenforceability of the parking regulations led to cars parked everywhere.
meanings.sent4: The nonenforceability of the decision left room for interpretation.
meanings.sent5: The nonenforceability of the rule created confusion among the students.
